<@UMA5B6XJ6> Yes it looks like when you are looking at crm_associations the deal actually returns the value. Which is odd that it is different. However, I am also getting the user’s id so I would just run this through the crm_object function that I did above and specify that you are looking that multiselect property and you should get the name instead of the value like in my example above.

 That will be easier than grabbing the property and looping through all of the options until you find the one that matches the value that the deal is showing
OK, I'll give this a try, thank you!

Hi everyone,
Is there any way to increase limit for hubdb_table_rows as HubSpot defined 10 request per page?

We do not increase the limit on a per account basis.

The reason for the limit is that each rows request can request up to 10,000 rows, and I’m not aware of a limit on the number of columns.

So if you were to execute 10 of those requests on a page you’d be able to get 100,000 rows of data. Hurting your web page’s performance.

If you’re querying the same DB multiple times in a page, you should set the value of the HubDB queries to a variable and filter/sort the data. That enables you to limit the number of queries you’re making.

Additionally you can use JavaScript to query your HubDB data using the HubDB API and display it using JavaScript. There is no limit to how many HubDB’s you query against using JavaScript.
anyone ever try adding IDs to headings in a rich text area with HubL?
Hey guys , i really need help, I have been trying to edit my source code in the design tools but i am not seeing any changes happen on my webpage
try adding a query string to the end of the url
can you elaborate more on how i can do this

Hey <@U7V9DQ31P>
Like this?
`{% dnd_module path='@HubSpot/rich_text' width=12 %}`
  `{% module_attribute "html"%}`
    `<h1 *id="{{name}}__target"* style="text-align:center;">This is your main headline.</h1>`
    `<p style="text-align:center;">Use this space to tell everyone about what you have to offer.</p>`
  `{% end_module_attribute %}`
`{% end_dnd_module %}`

Hey <@U0177RKAS1H>
When you say break the website, are you're trying to render the contents as html or as text?
